column5: A surge in refining profits boosted quarterly results at Exxon Mobil Corp and Chevron Corp  helping to offset declining oil and gas production and falling crude oil prices.

column4: Exxon sticking with capex budget around $37 billion

column4: U.S. regulators fine Ferrari $3.5 million for not filing reports
column5: DETROIT  Oct 31 Fiat Chrysler Automobiles'   Ferrari sports car brand has been fined $3.5 million for not filing "early warning reports" indicating safety issues with U.S. safety regulators  the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Friday.

column4: Freeport Indonesia union cancels planned one-month strike
column5: JAKARTA  Oct 31 Workers at Freeport-McMoRan Inc's Indonesian copper mine have cancelled a planned one-month strike due to start next week  a union official said on Friday  after reaching an agreement with the company's management following two days of talks.

column4: U.S. October auto sales seen rising 6 percent -Reuters poll
column5: DETROIT  Oct 31 The U.S. auto industry continued its moderate recovery in October and will show a 5.7-percent rise in sales from last year  analysts polled by Reuters said.
